{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Land Surveyor",
  "description": "Rhema Project, a&nbsp;Construction (Building and Infrastructure) and Agriculture&nbsp;company,&nbsp;is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Land Surveyor

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Engineering / Projects / Construction
Reports To: Site Manager / Head of Survey

Job Summary


	The Land Surveyor is responsible for conducting surveys to determine land boundaries, measurements, topography, and construction layouts.
	The role provides precise data for design, planning, and execution of engineering and construction projects.
	The Land Surveyor ensures accuracy, compliance with project specifications, and adherence to local regulations and standards.


Key&nbsp;Responsibilities
Site Surveying and Data Collection:


	Conduct topographical, boundary, and as-built surveys using modern surveying equipment (e.g., Total Station, GPS, Level, and Theodolite).
	Establish control points and benchmarks for construction works.
	Carry out setting-out operations for structures, roads, utilities, and other site features.
	Perform leveling and coordinate checks to ensure construction accuracy.


Data Analysis and Interpretation:


	Process and analyse survey data using appropriate software (e.g., AutoCAD Civil 3D, GIS, Leica Geo Office, or similar).
	Prepare detailed survey drawings, contour maps, and reports.
	Verify data accuracy and resolve discrepancies between design and actual site conditions.


Coordination and Documentation:


	Work closely with project engineers, architects, and contractors to provide accurate survey data for design and execution.
	Maintain comprehensive survey records, field notes, and digital data archives.
	Prepare and submit survey progress reports and documentation for project milestones.


Equipment Management:


	Ensure all surveying instruments are properly calibrated and maintained.
	Manage and safeguard surveying tools and ensure their readiness for daily operations.
	Report equipment faults or malfunctions promptly for repair or replacement.


Compliance and Quality Assurance:


	Ensure all surveying activities comply with statutory regulations, project specifications, and industry standards.
	Adhere to quality assurance and health &amp; safety protocols during all site operations.
	Support verification of subcontractor survey work and ensure alignment with project control points.


Stakeholder Communication:


	Liaise with consultants, local authorities, and other stakeholders for survey verification and approvals.
	Provide technical support to the project team during design, layout, and construction stages.


Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Accuracy of survey data and layout works.
	Timeliness in completing survey tasks and reports.
	Proper maintenance and calibration of instruments.
	Compliance with HSE and quality standards.
	Effective coordination with project and site teams.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree or Higher National Diploma (HND) in Surveying, Geomatics, or related field.
	3 &ndash; 5 years of professional experience in land or construction surveying.
	Membership or certification from a recognized professional body (e.g., NIS, SURCON, RICS, or equivalent) is an advantage.
	Proficiency in surveying equipment (Total Station, GPS, Level) and relevant software (AutoCAD, Civil 3D, GIS tools).
	Good understanding of civil and structural drawings.


Key Skills and Competencies


	Strong technical and mathematical skills.
	Excellent attention to detail and accuracy.
	Proficiency in digital surveying technologies and data processing.
	Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities.
	Effective communication and teamwork skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
	Commitment to safety, quality, and precision.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hrbp2@rhemaprojectng.com&nbsp;using &quot;Land Surveyor&quot;&nbsp;as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-06",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Rhema Project"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",

    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Land Surveyor Job at Rhema Project




        
    

        
        Rhema Project, a Construction (Building and Infrastructure) and Agriculture company, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Land Surveyor

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Engineering / Projects / Construction
Reports To: Site Manager / Head of Survey

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Land Surveyor is responsible for conducting surveys to determine land boundaries, measurements, topography, and construction layouts.
	The role provides precise data for design, planning, and execution of engineering and construction projects.
	The Land Surveyor ensures accuracy, compliance with project specifications, and adherence to local regulations and standards.


Key Responsibilities
Site Surveying and Data Collection:


	Conduct topographical, boundary, and as-built surveys using modern surveying equipment (e.g., Total Station, GPS, Level, and Theodolite).
	Establish control points and benchmarks for construction works.
	Carry out setting-out operations for structures, roads, utilities, and other site features.
	Perform leveling and coordinate checks to ensure construction accuracy.


Data Analysis and Interpretation:


	Process and analyse survey data using appropriate software (e.g., AutoCAD Civil 3D, GIS, Leica Geo Office, or similar).
	Prepare detailed survey drawings, contour maps, and reports.
	Verify data accuracy and resolve discrepancies between design and actual site conditions.


Coordination and Documentation:


	Work closely with project engineers, architects, and contractors to provide accurate survey data for design and execution.
	Maintain comprehensive survey records, field notes, and digital data archives.
	Prepare and submit survey progress reports and documentation for project milestones.


Equipment Management:


	Ensure all surveying instruments are properly calibrated and maintained.
	Manage and safeguard surveying tools and ensure their readiness for daily operations.
	Report equipment faults or malfunctions promptly for repair or replacement.


Compliance and Quality Assurance:


	Ensure all surveying activities comply with statutory regulations, project specifications, and industry standards.
	Adhere to quality assurance and health & safety protocols during all site operations.
	Support verification of subcontractor survey work and ensure alignment with project control points.


Stakeholder Communication:


	Liaise with consultants, local authorities, and other stakeholders for survey verification and approvals.
	Provide technical support to the project team during design, layout, and construction stages.


Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Accuracy of survey data and layout works.
	Timeliness in completing survey tasks and reports.
	Proper maintenance and calibration of instruments.
	Compliance with HSE and quality standards.
	Effective coordination with project and site teams.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree or Higher National Diploma (HND) in Surveying, Geomatics, or related field.
	3 – 5 years of professional experience in land or construction surveying.
	Membership or certification from a recognized professional body (e.g., NIS, SURCON, RICS, or equivalent) is an advantage.
	Proficiency in surveying equipment (Total Station, GPS, Level) and relevant software (AutoCAD, Civil 3D, GIS tools).
	Good understanding of civil and structural drawings.


Key Skills and Competencies


	Strong technical and mathematical skills.
	Excellent attention to detail and accuracy.
	Proficiency in digital surveying technologies and data processing.
	Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities.
	Effective communication and teamwork skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
	Commitment to safety, quality, and precision.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrbp2@rhemaprojectng.com using "Land Surveyor" as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Sales Executive",
  "description": "Tribest Corporate Support Limited is a corporate support solutions provider with a comprehensive range of people outsourcing services. We have a diversified team of management, strategy, banking and capacity development experts working together to provide organizations with the best human resource management solutions. With a team that diverse, we are setting new standards of performance and raising the bar in excellent service delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Positionm: Sales Executive

Job Locations:&nbsp;Lagos Island, Lekki, Ajah, and Yaba - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Sales and Business Development:


	Actively seek out new sales opportunities through networking, cold calling, and referrals.
	Meet and exceed sales targets for various banking products and services.
	Develop and execute strategic sales plans to expand the bank&rsquo;s customer base.
	Prepare and present sales proposals to potential clients, tailoring solutions to their specific needs.


Client Relationship Management:


	Build and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with both new and existing clients.
	Serve as a primary point of contact for clients, providing professional and timely support.
	Conduct regular follow-ups to ensure client satisfaction and identify opportunities for upselling or cross-selling.


Product Knowledge and Compliance:


	Maintain a deep understanding of all banking products, services, and policies.
	Stay informed about market trends, competitor activities, and new financial regulations.
	Ensure all sales activities are conducted in full compliance with bank policies and regulatory requirements.


Reporting and Administration:


	Prepare and submit regular sales reports, including forecasts and performance analysis.
	Accurately document all client interactions and sales activities in the CRM system.
	Collaborate with other departments to ensure a smooth and efficient customer onboarding process.


Requirements


	B.Sc. Degree / HND qualification in any discipline.
	0 - 5 years of relevant work experience.
	Must not be above 35 years.
	Customer oriented and with impressive interpersonal skills.
	Passionate about Sales and target driven.
	Available to resume immediately.
	Cross-sell bank products to customers.

  "validThrough": "2025-11-04",

Sales Executive Job at Tribest Corporate Support Limited




        
    

        
        Tribest Corporate Support Limited is a corporate support solutions provider with a comprehensive range of people outsourcing services. We have a diversified team of management, strategy, banking and capacity development experts working together to provide organizations with the best human resource management solutions. With a team that diverse, we are setting new standards of performance and raising the bar in excellent service delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Positionm: Sales Executive

Job Locations: Lagos Island, Lekki, Ajah, and Yaba - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Sales and Business Development:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Actively seek out new sales opportunities through networking, cold calling, and referrals.
	Meet and exceed sales targets for various banking products and services.
	Develop and execute strategic sales plans to expand the bank’s customer base.
	Prepare and present sales proposals to potential clients, tailoring solutions to their specific needs.


Client Relationship Management:


	Build and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with both new and existing clients.
	Serve as a primary point of contact for clients, providing professional and timely support.
	Conduct regular follow-ups to ensure client satisfaction and identify opportunities for upselling or cross-selling.


Product Knowledge and Compliance:


	Maintain a deep understanding of all banking products, services, and policies.
	Stay informed about market trends, competitor activities, and new financial regulations.
	Ensure all sales activities are conducted in full compliance with bank policies and regulatory requirements.


Reporting and Administration:


	Prepare and submit regular sales reports, including forecasts and performance analysis.
	Accurately document all client interactions and sales activities in the CRM system.
	Collaborate with other departments to ensure a smooth and efficient customer onboarding process.


Requirements


	B.Sc. Degree / HND qualification in any discipline.
	0 - 5 years of relevant work experience.
	Must not be above 35 years.
	Customer oriented and with impressive interpersonal skills.
	Passionate about Sales and target driven.
	Available to resume immediately.
	Cross-sell bank products to customers.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Power Systems Technician

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Responsible for the operations, maintenance and repair of the Electrical Power systems at the Data Centres and Point of Presence (POP) owned by the organisation. The Ideal candidate must reside on the Island.


Responsibilities


	Execute preventive maintenance schedules with/without third party vendors and update relevant documentation and checklist.
	Maintenance of various types of electrical power systems e.g. Switchgear, UPS, Generating sets, Rectifiers Inverters, Batter systems, AVR, ATS units, Transformers, PDU/PMM units.
	Track trending operational characteristics
	Monitor and respond to abnormal conditions in the UPS system, generators and ATS.
	Maintain detailed and up-to-date records of operational issues for audits and SLA related purposes.
	Follow the good application of change and incident ticket linked to customers; Respect ITIL processes, incidents and changes to SLA.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	At least a Higher National Diploma (HND) in either Electrical and Electronics or other related disciplines
	At least 3 years of previous work experience in a Data Centre Operations environment or equivalent.
	Experience troubleshooting breakdowns and repairing electrical power systems devices and components.
	Experience with Portable Appliance Test System.
	Experience in maintenance planning, scheduling and associated maintenance work.
	Experience with Data Centre Infrastructure Management (DCIM) tools will be an added advantage.
	Possession of relevant industry certification or trainings in Electrical Power systems installation, maintenance, and/or repairs.
	Knowledge of equipment installation, electrical and mechanical repairs, welding and fabrication, and safety and compliance.
	Good knowledge of Microsoft Operating systems and Microsoft office suite.
	Adept at conducting tests to identify faults.

	Candidate must be able to lift, push and pull up to 20kg.
	Candidate must be able to tolerate temperature of below 20&deg; C for extended periods of time.
	Ability to maintain strong working relationships with both internal and external third parties.


Salary
N300,000 monthly.

Power Systems Technician Job at ipNX Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        ipNX is one of Nigeria’s fastest growing Information and Communications Technology companies, serving a multitude of needs across enterprises, small businesses and residents with innovative, world-class services.

Our ability to identify, satisfy and exceed today’s market needs is a testament to over a decade of experience, our commitment, drive and passion realized through highly skilled and well seasoned professionals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Power Systems Technician

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Responsible for the operations, maintenance and repair of the Electrical Power systems at the Data Centres and Point of Presence (POP) owned by the organisation. The Ideal candidate must reside on the Island.


Responsibilities


	Execute preventive maintenance schedules with/without third party vendors and update relevant documentation and checklist.
	Maintenance of various types of electrical power systems e.g. Switchgear, UPS, Generating sets, Rectifiers Inverters, Batter systems, AVR, ATS units, Transformers, PDU/PMM units.
	Track trending operational characteristics
	Monitor and respond to abnormal conditions in the UPS system, generators and ATS.
	Maintain detailed and up-to-date records of operational issues for audits and SLA related purposes.
	Follow the good application of change and incident ticket linked to customers; Respect ITIL processes, incidents and changes to SLA.


Qualifications & Experience


	At least a Higher National Diploma (HND) in either Electrical and Electronics or other related disciplines
	At least 3 years of previous work experience in a Data Centre Operations environment or equivalent.
	Experience troubleshooting breakdowns and repairing electrical power systems devices and components.
	Experience with Portable Appliance Test System.
	Experience in maintenance planning, scheduling and associated maintenance work.
	Experience with Data Centre Infrastructure Management (DCIM) tools will be an added advantage.
	Possession of relevant industry certification or trainings in Electrical Power systems installation, maintenance, and/or repairs.
	Knowledge of equipment installation, electrical and mechanical repairs, welding and fabrication, and safety and compliance.
	Good knowledge of Microsoft Operating systems and Microsoft office suite.
	Adept at conducting tests to identify faults.
	Demonstrated troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
	Candidate must be able to lift, push and pull up to 20kg.
	Candidate must be able to tolerate temperature of below 20° C for extended periods of time.
	Ability to maintain strong working relationships with both internal and external third parties.


Salary
N300,000 monthly.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Field Support Technician",
  "description": "ipNX is one of Nigeria&rsquo;s fastest growing Information and Communications Technology companies, serving a multitude of needs across enterprises, small businesses and residents with innovative, world-class services.

Our ability to identify, satisfy and exceed today&rsquo;s market needs is a testament to over a decade of experience, our commitment, drive and passion realized through highly skilled and well seasoned professionals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Field Support Technician

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	This role is responsible for carrying out planned and contingency operations and maintenance
	(O&amp;M) services in accordance with approved procedures and safety standards.


Responsibilities


	Identifies the root-cause of customer issue and advices on the best cause of action to resolve the issue.
	Identifies the resources needed to solve the issue and estimates the effort required.
	Collaborates with other internal functions to ensure availability of resources required to resolve the issue and keep the customer up to date on intervention efforts and relevant timelines.
	Implements technical solution at customer site while ensuring quality work and customer-satisfaction.
	Implements technical solution at Point of Presence sites in compliance with approved policies, procedures and work standards.
	Implements disaster recovery plan as and when needed.
	Implements proactive maintenance and sets up system monitoring, to reduce equipment failure and incident response time.
	Maintains engineering equipment.
	Diagnoses network and device problems and implements technical or procedural solutions.
	Performs Quality Control on structured cabling and related projects on all sites and other ipNX Facility.
	Performs inventory of equipment and consumables required on all sites, ensuring availability and repair / return of same.
	Maintains accurate records of the condition of systems, equipment in all buildings, and inspections.
	Prepares regular reports on all POPs conditions, inspections and work orders as may be necessary.


Qualifications/Experience


	A Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Engineering or a Technical discipline.
	3 years of relevant experience in the IT/Telecommunications field.
	Engineering and Design.
	Resources Management.
	Analytical Skills.
	Communication Skills.
	Problem Solving Skills.
	Stakeholder Management.


Salary
N300,000 monthly.

Field Support Technician Job at ipNX Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        ipNX is one of Nigeria’s fastest growing Information and Communications Technology companies, serving a multitude of needs across enterprises, small businesses and residents with innovative, world-class services.

Our ability to identify, satisfy and exceed today’s market needs is a testament to over a decade of experience, our commitment, drive and passion realized through highly skilled and well seasoned professionals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Field Support Technician

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	This role is responsible for carrying out planned and contingency operations and maintenance
	(O&M) services in accordance with approved procedures and safety standards.


Responsibilities


	Identifies the root-cause of customer issue and advices on the best cause of action to resolve the issue.
	Identifies the resources needed to solve the issue and estimates the effort required.
	Collaborates with other internal functions to ensure availability of resources required to resolve the issue and keep the customer up to date on intervention efforts and relevant timelines.
	Implements technical solution at customer site while ensuring quality work and customer-satisfaction.
	Implements technical solution at Point of Presence sites in compliance with approved policies, procedures and work standards.
	Implements disaster recovery plan as and when needed.
	Implements proactive maintenance and sets up system monitoring, to reduce equipment failure and incident response time.
	Maintains engineering equipment.
	Diagnoses network and device problems and implements technical or procedural solutions.
	Performs Quality Control on structured cabling and related projects on all sites and other ipNX Facility.
	Performs inventory of equipment and consumables required on all sites, ensuring availability and repair / return of same.
	Maintains accurate records of the condition of systems, equipment in all buildings, and inspections.
	Prepares regular reports on all POPs conditions, inspections and work orders as may be necessary.


Qualifications/Experience


	A Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or a Technical discipline.
	3 years of relevant experience in the IT/Telecommunications field.
	Engineering and Design.
	Resources Management.
	Analytical Skills.
	Communication Skills.
	Problem Solving Skills.
	Stakeholder Management.


Salary
N300,000 monthly.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Purchasing Officer",
  "description": "Gas Tech International Limited is a Compressed and Natural Gas organisation situated along the Sagamu-Ore expressway in Ilisan, Ikenne local government area, Ogun State.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Purchasing Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ilisan, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Procurement
Reports to: Human Resources and Administrative Manager

Position Summary


	The ideal candidate will be responsible for sourcing, negotiating, and procuring goods, and materials required for the smooth running of the facility.
	The role ensures timely procurement, cost efficiency, and compliance with quality and safety standards while maintainingstrong vendor relationships to support operations.


Key Functions


	Procuring goods, consumables, and services needed for plant operations in line with company policies.
	Managing vendor/supplier relationships, pricing negotiation, and securing cost-effective deals.
	Preparing purchase orders, maintaining accurate procurement records.
	Carry out quarterly market survey on product change, and pricing.
	Assist in budgeting and forecasting procurement needs for the plant/operations


Required Skills and Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree or HND in supplychain Management, Business Administration,or a related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience
	Goodknowledge of procurement regulations, compliance, and ethical sourcing.
	Integrity and Accountability: A good sense of honesty.
	Problem-solving and negotiation skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office and ERP/Procurement software.


Compensation and Benefits
We offer a competitive compensation package, including:


	A competitive Salary
	Health Maintenance Organisation (HMO) Plan
	Annual Leave allowance
	Statutory Pension Contributions
	Opportunities for training and Growth.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hrjobs@gastechltd.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-06",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-21",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Gas Tech International Limited"

Purchasing Officer Job at Gas Tech International Limited




        
    

        
        Gas Tech International Limited is a Compressed and Natural Gas organisation situated along the Sagamu-Ore expressway in Ilisan, Ikenne local government area, Ogun State.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Purchasing Officer

Job Location: Ilisan, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Procurement
Reports to: Human Resources and Administrative Manager

Position Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The ideal candidate will be responsible for sourcing, negotiating, and procuring goods, and materials required for the smooth running of the facility.
	The role ensures timely procurement, cost efficiency, and compliance with quality and safety standards while maintainingstrong vendor relationships to support operations.


Key Functions


	Procuring goods, consumables, and services needed for plant operations in line with company policies.
	Managing vendor/supplier relationships, pricing negotiation, and securing cost-effective deals.
	Preparing purchase orders, maintaining accurate procurement records.
	Carry out quarterly market survey on product change, and pricing.
	Assist in budgeting and forecasting procurement needs for the plant/operations


Required Skills and Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree or HND in supplychain Management, Business Administration,or a related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience
	Goodknowledge of procurement regulations, compliance, and ethical sourcing.
	Integrity and Accountability: A good sense of honesty.
	Problem-solving and negotiation skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office and ERP/Procurement software.


Compensation and Benefits
We offer a competitive compensation package, including:


	A competitive Salary
	Health Maintenance Organisation (HMO) Plan
	Annual Leave allowance
	Statutory Pension Contributions
	Opportunities for training and Growth.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrjobs@gastechltd.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
